title: IBPS RRB Clerk Prelims: Speed Math [Moderate] #QA009

questions.text:
What approximate value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$19.99\% \text{ of } 749.98 + \sqrt{783.99} - 12.01^2 = ?$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$45\% \text{ of } 400 + \sqrt{?} = 56\% \text{ of } 750 - 180$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$\frac{3}{8} \text{ of } 168 \times 15 \div 5 + ? = 500$$

What approximate value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$24.01^2 + 17.99^2 - 65.02\% \text{ of } 400.01 = ?$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$(256)^{0.25} \times (64)^{2} \div (16)^{3} = 4^{?}$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$360 \div 12 + 14 \times 8 - \sqrt{225} = ?$$

Find the wrong number in the series:
2, 3, 7, 15, 32, 57
questions.solution:
Differences should be squares: $$1, 4, 9, 16, 25$$
$$2 + 1 = 3$$
$$3 + 4 = 7$$
$$7 + 9 = 16$$ (Series has 15, so 15 is wrong)
Check: $$16 + 16 = 32$$ (Correct)

questions.text:
Find the missing number in the series:
8, 16, 48, 192, ?, 5760

Find the missing number in the series:
100, 102, 107, 117, 134, ?

What approximate value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$33.99\% \text{ of } 550.01 + 65.99\% \text{ of } 150.01 = ?$$

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$2750 \div 5.5 + 40 = 15 \times ?$$

Find the missing number in the series:
14, 8, 9, 14.5, 30, ?

Find the missing number in the series:
1000, 500, 250, 125, 62.5, ?

questions.solution:
I. $$(x-18)^2 = 0 \implies x = 18$$
II. Factors of 324 summing to 39 are 27 and 12. $$y = 27, 12$$
$$18 < 27$$ but $$18 > 12$$. Result: CND

questions.text:
What approximate value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$?^2 + 12.01^3 = 45.01^2 - 196.99$$

Find the wrong number in the series:
4, 3, 4, 7, 15, 37

What value should come in the place of question mark (?) in the following question?
$$3\frac{1}{6} + 4\frac{2}{3} - 1\frac{1}{2} = ? + 2\frac{1}{6}$$

Solve for x and y:
I. $$x = \sqrt{256}$$
II. $$y^2 = 256$$
questions.solution:
I. $$x = 16$$ (Square root function yields positive value)
II. $$y = +16, -16$$
$$16 = 16$$ and $$16 > -16$$. Result: $$x \ge y$$
